legislation.name: Fair Labor Standards Act — Meal and Rest Breaks (Federal)

rules.source_text: 29 C.F.R. § 785.18: Rest periods of short duration, running from 5 minutes to about 20 minutes, are common in industry. They promote the efficiency of the employee and are customarily paid for as working time. They must be counted as hours worked.

29 C.F.R. § 785.19: Bona fide meal periods are not worktime. The employee must be completely relieved from duty for the purposes of eating regular meals. Ordinarily 30 minutes or more is long enough for a bona fide meal period. The employee is not relieved if he is required to perform any duties, whether active or inactive, while eating.
